column4: faxing: what program do I need, and how do I know the modem on my laptop will work?
!fax
true hardware modems all work.. it is the soft/win modems that are a problem.  I got a plugin xircom pcmcia to get mine going
Find the modem by going to a terminal and typing dmesg | grep ttyS
What output should I expect?
the port of your modem
serial8250: ttyS1 at I/O 0x2f8 (irq = 3) is a 16550A
That does not look like your modem, that looks more like a regular serial port on the back of the box
cool..   we can try something if you want to find out
ok, what to try?
sudo screen /dev/ttyS1
then try ATZ in there and see if you get OK in response
all I get is a blank terminal window, can't seem to type anything
if it doesnt let you type and returns nothing then it isnt your modem....   Use ctrl-A then K to kill the modem terminal
ok, that sucks
The solution I used only cost me $20 and I should have done it sooner as I wasted days on it
I only need to send one fax

only for the US, not Canada
